abstract: Bank of America said on Tuesday that it lost $7.3 billion for the third quarter, after taking a previously announced $10.4 billion loss tied to its credit cards business.
snippet: Bank of America said on Tuesday that it lost $7.3 billion for the third quarter, after taking a previously announced $10.4 billion loss tied to its credit cards business.
lead_paragraph: 7:35 a.m. | Updated The New York Times’s Nelson D. Schwartz has more on Bank of America’s third-quarter earnings.

headline.main: BofA Posts $7.3 Billion Loss on One-Time Charge

abstract: Just so you know, the Citigroup chairman has a leather jacket that works. It does.
snippet: Just so you know, the Citigroup chairman has a leather jacket that works. It does.
lead_paragraph: 4:25 p.m. | Updated Daily Intel caught up with Richard D. Parsons, Citigroup‘s chairman, on Monday night at the Jazz Foundation of America‘s annual loft party on Sunday. Among the topics of conversation: Mr. Parsons’ leather jacket, an item of clothing he loved — he’s worn it a lot — but didn’t want written about.

headline.main: Citi’s Parsons Has a Leather Jacket That ‘Works’
